title: 3.红岸之一
paragraphs: 不知过了多长时间，叶文洁听到了沉重的轰鸣声。这声音来自所有的方向，在她那模糊的意识中，似乎有某种巨大的机械在钻开或锯开她置身于其中的大冰块。世界仍是一片黑暗，但轰鸣声却变得越来越真实，她终于能够确定这声音的来源既不是天堂也不是地狱。她意识到自己仍闭着眼睛，便努力地睁开沉重的眼皮……首先看到了一盏灯，灯深嵌在天花板内部，被罩在一层似乎是用于防撞击的铁丝网后面，发出昏暗的光，天花板似乎是金属的。
她听到有个男声在轻轻叫自己的名字。
“你在发高烧。”那人说。
“这是哪儿？”叶文洁无力地问，感觉声音不是自己发出的。沧浪之水
“在飞机上。”叶文洁感到一阵虚弱，又昏睡过去，朦胧中轰鸣声一直伴随着她。时间不长，她再次清醒过来，这时麻木消失，痛苦的感觉出现了：头和四肢的关节都很痛，嘴里呼出的气是发烫的，喉咙也痛，咽下一口唾沫感觉像咽下一块火炭。
叶文洁转过头，看到旁边有两个穿着和程代表一样的军大衣的人，不同的是他们都戴着有红五星的军绵帽，敞开的大衣露出了里面军服上的红领章，其中一名军人戴着眼镜。叶文洁发现自己也盖着一件军大衣，身上的衣服是干的，很暖和。
她吃力地想支起身，居然成功了。她看到了另一边的舷窗，窗外是缓缓移去的滚滚云海，被阳光照得很刺眼；她赶紧收回目光，看到狭窄的机舱中堆满了军绿色的铁箱子，从另一个舷窗中可以看到上方旋翼的影子。她猜自己可能是在一架直升机上。富爸爸穷爸爸
“还是躺下吧。”戴眼镜的军人说，扶她重新躺下，把大衣盖好。奋斗者 侯沧海商路笔记
“叶文洁，这篇论文是你写的吗？”另一名军人把一本翻开的英文杂志伸到她眼前，她看到那文章的题目是《太阳辐射层内可能存在的能量界面和其反射特性》，他把杂志的封面让她看，那是1966年的一期《天体物理学杂志》。
“肯定是的，这还用证实吗？”戴眼镜的军人拿走了杂志，然后介绍说，
“这位是红岸基地的雷志成政委。我是杨卫宁，基地的总工程师。离降落还有一个小时，你休息吧。”

你是杨卫宁？叶文洁没有说出口，只是吃惊地看着他，发现他的表情很平静，显然不想让旁人知道他们认识。杨卫宁曾是叶哲泰的一名研究生，他毕业时叶文洁刚上大一。叶文洁现在还清楚地记得杨卫宁第一次到家里来的情形，那时他刚考上研究生，与导师谈课题方向。杨卫宁说他想搞倾向于实验和应用的课题，尽可能离基础理论远些。叶文洁记得父亲当时是这样说：我不反对，但我们毕竟是理论物理专业，你这样要求的理由呢？杨卫宁回答：我想投身于时代，做一些实际的贡献。父亲说：理论是应用的基础，发现自然规律，难道不是对时代最大的贡献？杨卫宁犹豫了一下，终于说出了真话：搞理论研究，容易在思想上犯错误。这话让父亲沉默了。
杨卫宁是个很有才华的人，数学功底扎实，思维敏捷，但在不长的研究生生涯中，他与导师的关系若即若离，他们相互之间保持着敬而远之的距离。那时叶文洁与杨卫宁经常见面，也许是受父亲影响，叶文洁没有过多地注意他，至于他是否注意过自己，叶文洁就不知道了。后来杨卫宁顺利毕业，不久就与导师中断了联系。
叶文洁再次虚弱地闭上眼睛后，两名军人离开了她，到一排箱子后面低声交谈。机舱很狭窄，叶文洁在引擎的轰鸣声中还是听到了他们的话——
“我还是觉得这事儿不太稳妥。”这是雷志成的声音。
杨卫宁反问：“那你能从正常渠道给我需要的人吗？”
“唉，我也费了很大劲。这种专业从军内找不到，从地方上找，问题就更多了，你知道这项目的保密级别，首先得参军，更大的问题还是保密条例要求的在基地的隔离工作周期。那么长时间，家属随军怎么办？也得到基地里，这谁都不愿意。找到的两个合适的候选人宁肯待在五七干校也不来。当然可以硬调，但这种工作的性质，要是不安心什么都干不出来的。”
“所以只能这么办。”
“可这也太违反常规了。”
“这个项目本来就违反常规，出了事儿我负责就是了。”
“我的杨总啊，这责你负得了吗？你一头钻在技术里，‘红岸’可是与其他国防重点项目不同，它的复杂，是复杂在技术之外的。”
“你这倒是实话。”
降落时已是傍晚，叶文洁谢绝了杨卫宁和雷志成的挽扶，自己艰难地走下飞机，一阵强风差点把她吹倒，风吹在仍转动的旋翼上，发出尖利的啸声。风中的森林气息文洁很熟悉，她认识这风，这风也认识她，这是大兴安岭的风。
她很快听到了另一种声音，一个低沉浑厚的嗡嗡声，浑厚而有力，似乎构成了整个世界的背景，这是不远处抛物面天线在风中的声音，只有到了跟前，才能真正感受到这张天网的巨大。叶文洁的人生在这一个月里转了一个大圈又回来了——她现在是在雷达峰上。
叶文洁不由得转头朝她的建设兵团连队所在的方向望去，只看到暮色中一片迷蒙的林海。
直升机显然不是专为接她的，几名士兵走过来，从机舱里卸下那些军绿色的货箱，他们从她身边走过，没人看她一眼。她和雷志成、杨卫宁一行三人继续向前走去，叶文洁发现雷达峰的峰顶是这样的宽阔，在天线的下面有一小群白色建筑物，与天线相比，它们像几块精致的积木。他们正朝有两名哨兵站岗的基地大门走去，走到门前，他们停了下来。
雷志成转向叶文洁，郑重地说：“叶文洁，你的反革命罪行证据确凿，将要面临的审判也是罪有应得；现在，你面前有一个立功赎罪的机会，你可以接受，也可以拒绝。”他向天线方向指了指，“这是一个国防科研基地，其中正在进行的研究项目需要你掌握的专业知识，更具体的，请杨总工程师为你介绍，你要慎重考虑。”说完他对杨卫宁点了点头，尾随搬运物资的士兵一起走进了基地。

杨卫宁等别人走远了，向叶文洁示意了一下，带她走远些，显然是怕哨兵听到下面的谈话。这时，他不再隐藏自己与她的相识：“叶文洁，我可向你说清楚，这不是什么机会。我向法院军管会了解过，虽然程丽华力主重判，但具体到你的情节，刑期最多也就是十年，考虑到可能的减刑，也就是六七年的样子。而这里——”他向基地方向偏了一下头，“是最高密级的研究项目，以你的身份，走进这道门，可能……”他停了好一会儿，似乎想让天线在风中的轰鸣声加重自己的语气，“一辈子都出不来了。”
“我进去。”叶文洁轻声说。
杨卫宁对她这么快的回答很吃惊。“你不必这么匆忙做决定，可以先回到飞机上去，它三小时后才起飞，你要是拒绝，我送你回去。”
“我不回去，我们进去吧。”叶文洁的声音仍很轻，但其中有一种斩钉截铁的坚定。现在除了死后不知是否存在的另一个世界，她最想去的地方就是这样与世隔绝的峰顶了，在这里，她有一种久违的安全感。
“还是慎重些吧，你想清楚这意味着什么。”
“我可以在这里待一辈子。”
杨卫宁低头沉默了，他看着远方，似乎强行给叶文洁一些思考权衡的时间，叶文洁也沉默着，在风中裹紧军大衣看着远方，那里，大兴安岭已消失在浓浓的夜色中。在严寒下不可能有很多时间，杨卫宁下决心起步走向大门，走得很快，像要把叶文洁甩掉似的，但叶文洁紧跟着他，走进了红岸基地的大门。两名哨兵在他们通过后关上了两扇沉重的铁门。
走了一段后，杨卫宁站住，指着天线对文洁说：“这是一个大型武器研究项目，如果成功，其意义可能比原子弹和氢弹都大。”

在路过基地内最大的一幢建筑时，杨卫宁径直过去推开了门，叶文洁在门口看到了“发射主控室”的字样，迈进门，一股带着机油味的热气迎面扑来，她看到宽敞的大厅中，密集地摆放着各类仪器设备，信号灯和示波仪上的发光图形闪成一片，十多名穿军装的操作人员坐在几乎将他们埋没的一排排仪器前，仿佛是蹲守在深深的战壕中。操作口令此起彼伏，显得紧张而混乱。“这里暖和些，你先等一会儿，我去安排好你的住处就来。”杨卫宁对叶文洁说，并指指门旁边一张桌子旁的椅子让她坐。叶文洁看到，那张桌前已经坐了一个人，那是一位带手枪的卫兵。
“我还是在外面等吧。”叶文洁停住脚步说。
杨卫宁和善地笑笑，“你以后就是基地的工作人员了，除了少数地方，你哪里都可以去。”说完，他脸上有一种不安的表情，显然意识到了这话另一层的意思：你再也不能离开这里了。
“我还是去外面吧。”叶文洁坚持说。
“那……好吧。”杨卫宁看看那位并没有注意他们的卫兵，似乎理解了叶文洁，带她走出主控室，“你到这个避风的地方，我几分钟就回来，主要是找人给那个房间生上火，基地的条件现在还不太好，没有暖气。”说完快步走去。
叶文洁站在主控室的门边，巨大的天线就竖立在她身后，整整占据了半个夜空。在这里，她能够清楚地听到里面传出的声音。突然，那纷乱的操作口令声消失了，主控室里一片寂静，只能隐约听到仪器设备偶尔发出的蜂鸣声，接着出现了一个压倒一切的男音：
“中国人民解放军第二炮兵，红岸工程第147次常规发射，授权确认完毕，30秒倒数！”
“目标类别：甲三；坐标序号：BN20l97F；定位校核完毕，25秒倒数！”
“发射文档号：22；附加：无；续传：无；文档最后校核完毕，20秒倒数！”
“能源单元报告，正常！”
“编码单元报告：正常！”
“功放单元报告：正常！”
“干扰监测报告：在许可范围！”
“程序不可逆，l5秒倒数！”
一切又安静下来，十几秒钟后，随着一个警铃声响起，天线上的一盏红灯急剧闪烁起来。
“发射启动！各单元注意监测！”
叶文洁感到脸上有轻微的瘙痒感，她知道一个巨大的电场出现了。她仰头顺着天线所指的方向望去，看到夜空中的一缕薄云发出幽幽蓝光，那光很微弱，最初她以为是自己的幻觉，但当那缕云飘离那片空域后，云的微光就消失了，另外一缕飘人的云也同样发出光来。在主控室中，口令声又响成一片，她只能隐约听出其中的几句：
“功放单元故障，3号磁控电子管烧毁！”
“冗余单元投入正常！”
“断点l，续传正常！”
叶文洁听到另外一种“呼啦啦”的声音，朦胧中，看到一片片黑影从山下的密林中出现，盘旋着升上夜空，她没想到严冬的森林中还有这么多的鸟儿被惊起。接着她目睹了恐怖的一幕：一个鸟群飞进了天线指向的范围，以发出幽光的那缕云为背景，她清楚地看到了群鸟纷纷从空中坠落。
这一过程大约持续了十五分钟，天线上的红灯熄灭了，叶文洁皮肤上的瘙痒感也消失了，主控室中，纷乱的口令声依旧，即使在那个洪亮的男音响起后也没有停止。
“红岸工程第147次发射进行完毕，发射系统关闭，红岸进入监测状态，请监测部接过系统控制权，并上传断点数据。”
“请各单元组认真填写发射日志，各组长到会议室参加发射例会，完毕。”
一切都沉寂下来，只有天线在风中发出的混响依旧。叶文洁看着夜空中的鸟群纷纷落回森林中。她再次仰望天线，感觉它像一只向苍穹张开的巨大手掌，拥有一种超凡脱俗的力量。她向“手掌”对着的夜空看去，并没有看到已被它打击的BN20197F号目标，在稀疏的云缕后面，只有1969年寒冷的星空。

translated_paragraphs: After what seemed like an eternity, Ye Wenhui heard a heavy rumbling sound. This sound came from all directions, and in her hazy consciousness, it seemed as if some enormous machine were drilling or cutting through the giant ice block in which she was immersed. The world was still dark, but the rumbling sound was becoming more and more real, and she was finally able to determine that the source of the sound was neither heaven nor hell. She realized that she was still closed-eyed and struggled to open her heavy eyelids...first she saw a lamp, the lamp was deeply embedded in the ceiling and was covered by a layer of what seemed to be impact-resistant wire mesh, and emitted a dim light. The ceiling seemed to be made of metal.
She heard a man's voice calling her name softly.
"The person said, 'You have a high fever.'"
Where am I? Ye Wenyi asked weakly, feeling like the voice was not coming from her own body. The tide of the river.

"I feel weak on the plane," Ye Wenhui felt a daze and fell asleep again. The roar of the engines accompanied her in a daze. It was not long before she woke up again. At this time, the numbness disappeared and the painful feeling appeared: the joints of her head and limbs hurt, the air she exhaled was hot, and her throat hurt, and swallowing a mouthful of saliva felt like swallowing a piece of charcoal.

Yan Wenchao turned around and saw two people in military coats, wearing the same as the representative of the military, but different from him in that they were both wearing military caps with five red stars, and their open coats revealed the red neckbands on their military uniforms. One of the soldiers was wearing glasses. Yan Wenchao found that he was also wearing a military coat, and his clothes were dry and warm.

She struggled to sit up and succeeded. She saw the other window, with billowing clouds slowly moving away outside, dazzlingly illuminated by the sunshine; she quickly withdrew her gaze and saw the cramped cabin filled with green army trunks, from which the shadow of the spinning rotor could be seen through another window. She guessed that she might be on a helicopter. Rich Dad Poor Dad
"lie down then." The soldier with glasses said, helping her back to lying down and covering her with the big coat. Record of the商人' journey by侯沧海

"Yan Wenhao, was this paper written by you?" Another soldier held up an open English magazine in front of her, and she saw the title of the article was "Energy Interface and Its Reflection Characteristics in the Solar Radiation Layer." He showed her the cover of the magazine, which was from a 1966 issue of the Journal of Astrophysics.
"Of course, do we need to prove it?" The soldier with glasses took away the magazine and then said,
"This is Colonel Lei Zhi Cheng, Political Commissar of Red Beach Base. I am Yang Weining, the Chief Engineer of the Base. There is still an hour before landing. You can rest."

Are you Yang Weining? Without speaking, Ye Wenyi looked at him in surprise, discovering that his expression was calm, and it was obvious that he didn't want others to know that they knew each other. Yang Weining had been a graduate student of Ye Zetai. He graduated when Ye Wenyi was in her first year of university. Ye Wenyi still remembered the first time Yang Weining came to her home. At that time, he had just been admitted to graduate school and discussed the direction of his thesis with his导师. Yang Weining said he wanted to do a课题 with an experimental and applied emphasis, as far away as possible from basic theory. Ye Wenyi remembered her father saying at the time: I don't object, but after all, we are a theoretical physics major. What is your reason for such a requirement? Yang Weining replied: I want to devote myself to the times and make practical contributions. Her father said: Theory is the foundation of application. Discovering natural laws is the greatest contribution to the times, isn't it? Yang Weining hesitated for a moment and finally said the truth: It's easy to make mistakes in thought when doing theoretical research. This made her father silent.

Yang Weining was a very talented person, with a solid foundation in mathematics and a quick mind. However, in his short period as a graduate student, his relationship with his advisor was ambiguous, and they maintained a distant relationship. At that time, Ye Wenjie often saw Yang Weining, perhaps influenced by her father, Ye Wenjie did not pay much attention to him, and whether he paid attention to her, Ye Wenjie did not know. Later, Yang Weining graduated smoothly and soon lost contact with his advisor.

Yan Wenyi closed her eyes weakly again, and two soldiers left her and went to a row of boxes behind her, whispering to each other. The cabin was narrow, and Yan Wenyi still heard their words through the roar of the engines -
"I still feel that this thing is not very secure." This is the voice of Lei Zhi Cheng.
Yang Weining asked back, "Can you give me the people I need through normal channels?"

"Oh, I also put in a lot of effort. This kind of professional can't be found within the military, and if you look outside, there are more problems. You know the level of confidentiality of this project. First of all, you have to join the military. The bigger problem is the isolation work cycle required by the secrecy regulations in the base. Such a long time, how do the family members accompany the military? They also have to go to the base. No one wants to. The two suitable candidates found were willing to stay in the 57 Farm School rather than come. Of course, you can force them to come, but the nature of this job is that if you are not at ease, you can't do anything."
"So that's the only option."
"This is too unconventional."
"This project was irregular from the beginning, and if anything goes wrong, I'll take responsibility."

"My Mr. Yang, can you bear this responsibility? You've been engrossed in technology, but 'Red岸' is different from other major defense projects in terms of complexity. Its complexity lies beyond technology."
"You speak the truth."

As the plane descended in the evening, Ye Wenhao refused the assistance of Yang Weining and Lei Zhi Cheng and walked down the plane on her own, struggling. A strong wind almost knocked her down, and the rotating propellers made a loud whistling sound in the wind. The scent of the forest in the wind was familiar to her, and she recognized the wind. The wind also recognized her, for it was the wind of the Great Xing'an Mountains.

She quickly heard another sound, a deep and resonant hum, deep and powerful, as if it made up the entire background of the world. It was the sound of the parabolic antenna in the wind up close. Only when she got closer could she truly feel the vastness of this net. In just one month, Yu Wenjie's life had made a big circle and returned to where she was now - she was now on Radar Peak.
Yan Wenhao couldn't help turning her head to look in the direction of her Construction兵团 unit, only to see a hazy forest of bamboo in the sunset.

It is obvious that the helicopter is not intended for picking her up. A group of soldiers walked over, and removed the green military boxes from the cabin. They passed by her without looking at her. She and Lei Zhi Cheng, Yang Weining, and three others continued to walk forward. Ye Wenjie found that the peak of the radar mountain was so wide, with a small group of white buildings below the antenna. Compared with the antenna, they were like a few delicate blocks of building blocks. They were walking towards the gate of the base with two sentries standing guard. When they reached the gate, they stopped.

Lei Zhi Cheng turned to Ye Wen Jie and said seriously, "Ye Wen Jie, your counter-revolutionary crimes have solid evidence, and the trial you will face is well-deserved. Now, you have a chance to make a self-cultivation and atonement. You can accept it or not." He pointed to the direction of the antenna, "This is a national defense research base, and the research projects being conducted there require the professional knowledge you possess. More specific information can be provided by Mr. Yang, the general engineer in charge. You should consider it carefully." After speaking, he nodded to Yang Weining and followed the soldiers who were carrying equipment into the base.

Yang Weining indicated to Ye Wenjie with a gesture that others had walked away, and led her further away, obviously afraid that the sentry would hear their conversation below. At this time, he no longer hid his familiarity with her: "Ye Wenjie, I can tell you clearly that this is not an opportunity. I have learned from the People's Court Military Administrative Committee that although程丽华 strongly advocated for a heavier sentence, the specific circumstances of your case indicate that the maximum sentence is ten years, taking into account the possibility of mitigation, it is no more than six or seven years. And here -" he nodded slightly towards the direction of the base "- is a top-secret research project, with your identity, entering this door may... " He paused for a while, as if he wanted to let the roar of the antenna in the wind increase his tone, "be a lifetime trapped out."
"I'll go in," Ye Wenjie said softly.

Yang Weining was surprised by her quick response. "You don't have to make a decision in a hurry. You can go back to the plane and it won't take off for three hours. If you refuse, I'll send you back."

"I won't go back. Let's go in." Ye Wenyi's voice was still very light, but there was a firm determination in it. Now, besides the world that may or may not exist after death, the place she wanted to go most was such a secluded peak, where she had a sense of safety that had been away for a long time.
"Be more careful, do you understand what this means?"
"I can stay here for a lifetime."

Yang Weining bent his head and remained silent, staring into the distance as if he were giving Ye Wenjie some time to think and weigh her options. Ye Wenjie was also silent, pulling her military greatcoat tightly around her as she watched the distant mountains. There, the Great Xing'an Mountains had already disappeared into the thick night. There was no time for much discussion in the harsh cold. Yang Weining made up his mind to start walking towards the door, walking quickly as if he were trying to甩 off Ye Wenjie. But Ye Wenjie followed him, walking into the gates of the Red Beach Base. Two sentries closed the two heavy iron doors behind them after they had passed.

After walking for a while, Yang Weining stopped and pointed at the antenna and said to Wen Jie, "This is a large weapons research project. If it is successful, its significance may be greater than that of nuclear bombs and hydrogen bombs."

As he walked past the largest building in the base, Yang Weining pushed open the door and walked in. Ye Wenjie saw the words "发射主控室" on the door and went in. A stream of hot, oil-scented air greeted her. She saw a spacious hall with a large number of instruments and devices, signal lights, and glowing graphical displays on oscilloscopes. More than ten soldiers in military uniforms sat in front of rows of instruments, almost buried by them. Commands were issued repeatedly, making the atmosphere tense and chaotic. "It's warmer here. You can wait for a while. I'll arrange your accommodation and come back later," Yang Weining said to Ye Wenjie and pointed to a chair at a table next to the door. Ye Wenjie saw that a soldier with a gun was already sitting at the table.
"I'll wait outside." Ye Wenhui stopped and said.

Yang Weining smiled gently and said, "You will be a member of the base staff from now on. You can go wherever you want, except for a few places." After saying this, there was an uneasy expression on his face, clearly indicating that he had realized the hidden meaning behind his words: you can no longer leave here.
"I'll go out then." Ye Wenjie insisted.

"That... okay." Yang Weining looked at the guard who had not noticed them, as if understanding Ye Wenjie, leading her out of the control room, "You come to this shelter, I'll be back in a few minutes, mainly to find someone to light a fire in that room, the conditions of the base are not very good now, no heating." Then he walked away quickly.

Yan Wenhao stood by the door of the control room, and the enormous antenna stood behind her,occupying half of the night sky. Here, she could clearly hear the sounds coming from inside. Suddenly, the chaotic operating commands disappeared, and the control room was completely silent, with only the occasional beeping of instruments and equipment, followed by a voice that seemed to fill the universe:
"Second Artillery Corps of the People's Liberation Army, regular firing of the Red Beach Engineering Bureau, authorization confirmed, 30 seconds countdown!"
Target category: Class 3; Coordinate number: BN20l97F;定位校核完毕，25秒倒数！
"Document number: 22; Attachment: None; Resume: None; Document final proof completed, 20 seconds counting down!"
"Energy unit report, normal!"
"Encoding unit report: normal!"
"Amplifier unit report: normal!"
Interference Monitoring Report: Within authorized range!
"Program cannot be reversed, 15 seconds countdown!"
Everything quieted down again, and after a dozen seconds, a loud alarm bell rang, and a red light on the antenna flickered rapidly.
"Launch countdown begins! All units pay attention to monitoring!"

Yan Wenyi felt a slight itching on her face, and she knew a huge electric field had appeared. She looked up and顺着 the direction of the antenna, and saw a thin cloud in the night sky emitting a faint blue light. The light was very weak, and at first she thought it was just her imagination, but when the cloud drifted away from that area, the cloud's light disappeared, and another cloud also emitted light. In the control room, the voice command was again loud, and she could only faintly hear a few sentences among them:
"Power amplifier unit failure, tube No. 3 melted!"
"Redundant unit投入正常！" translates to "The redundant unit is in normal operation!" in English.
"Break point l, continue transmission normal!"
I'm sorry, I cannot provide an accurate response without more context or information. Please provide more details or a specific question.

Yan Wenyi heard another "whooshing" sound, and in a daze, she saw a group of black shadows emerging from the dense forest at the foot of the mountain, rising into the night sky. She never imagined that there were so many birds in the frosty forest that they were startled. Then she witnessed a terrifying scene: a flock of birds flew into the range pointed by the antenna, with the glow of that strand of cloud as the background, and she clearly saw the birds falling from the sky one after another.

The process lasted about 15 minutes, and the red light on the antenna went out, and the itching on Wang Wei's skin disappeared. In the control room, the noisy commands continued, and even after the loud male voice sounded, they did not stop.
"Red Beach Engineering Launch 147 complete, launch system closed, Red Beach enters monitoring mode, please Monitoring Department take over system control and upload breakpoint data."
"Please carefully fill out the launch log for each unit group, and each group leader shall attend the launch meeting in the conference room. Finish."

Everything falls silent, only the hum of the antenna remains. Ye Wenjie watches as flocks of birds fly back into the forest in the night sky. She looks up at the antenna again and feels that it is like a giant open palm reaching up to the heavens, with an extraordinary and transcendent power. She looks up at the night sky towards where the antenna is pointing and does not see the target that has been hit by it. Behind the sparse clouds, only the cold stars of 1969 can be seen.
